Monaco

24 Jun 2014

Interesting Fact

Monaco is officially called the Principality of Monaco. It is the second smallest country in the world. Monaco was originally a colony of Genoa in 1215, and it has been ruled by the House of Grimaldi since 1297. It was briefly under French control from 1793 to 1814. Monacoâ€™s sovereignty was recognized in 1861 by the Franco-Monegasque treaty.

Monaco has an area of 2.02 sq km and a population of 36,000.

There is no income tax in Monaco, as profits from its casinos pay for government expenses.
